name: abnormal abdominal vessels
description: Atypical structure or position of blood vessels in the abdomen.

name: abnormal position of the heart
description: Heart located in an atypical position within the thorax.

name: abnormality on splenic arteriography
description: Unusual findings observed during imaging of splenic arteries.

name: acyanotic congenital heart disease with increased pulmonary vascularity
description: Congenital heart defect without cyanosis but with increased blood flow to lungs.

name: acyanotic congenital heart disease with normal pulmonary vascularity
description: Congenital heart defect without cyanosis and normal blood flow to lungs.

name: anemia
description: Condition with reduced hemoglobin or red blood cells.

name: aneurysm of abdominal aorta or its branches
description: Dilation of the abdominal aorta or its branches due to weakening of the vessel wall.

name: anomalous thoracic arterial communication
description: Abnormal connection between thoracic arteries.

name: anomaly of inferior vena cava
description: Structural abnormality of the inferior vena cava.

name: aortic aneurysm
description: Localized enlargement of the aortic vessel.

name: aortic arch anomaly
description: Structural irregularity of the aortic arch.

name: aortic insufficiency
description: Inadequate closure of the aortic valve leading to backflow of blood.

name: aortic valve disease
description: Disease affecting the aortic valve, potentially causing stenosis or regurgitation.

name: arterial aneurysm
description: Abnormal bulge in the wall of an artery aside from the aorta.

name: arterial calcification
description: Deposition of calcium in the arterial walls.

name: arterial dilatation
description: Widening of the artery beyond normal dimensions.

name: arterial dissection
description: Tear in the artery wall creating a false lumen.

name: arterial occlusion
description: Blockage of an artery reducing blood flow.

name: arterial rupture
description: Tear through all arterial wall layers leading to bleeding.

name: arterial tortuosity
description: Twisting or curving of arteries.

name: arteriovenous fistulas
description: Abnormal connection between an artery and a vein

name: atherosclerosis
description: Thickening or hardening of the arteries due to plaque buildup

name: avascular intracranial mass
description: A brain mass lacking blood vessels

name: avascular renal mass
description: A mass in the kidney without blood supply

name: avascular zone near the brain surface
description: Area near the brain surface lacking vasculature

name: bleeding tendency
description: Increased propensity for bleeding

name: brain ischemia secondary to extracranial lesion
description: Decreased blood flow to the brain caused by extracranial obstruction

name: branchial arch anomaly
description: Congenital defect related to branchial arches

name: Budd-Chiari syndrome
description: Condition characterized by hepatic vein thrombosis

name: calcification in great vessels
description: Calcium deposits in major arteries such as aorta

name: cardiac or pericardial neoplasm or cyst
description: Tumor or cyst located in or around the heart

name: cardiomyopathy
description: Disease of the heart muscle affecting its function

name: cerebral arterial disease
description: Condition affecting the arteries within the brain

name: cerebral vessel wall irregularity
description: Irregularities in the walls of cerebral blood vessels

name: cerebrovascular malformation
description: Abnormal connection or arrangement of brain blood vessels

name: claudication
description: Painful cramping due to inadequate blood flow, often in the legs

name: coarctation of aorta
description: Narrowing of the aorta

name: common origin of carotid arteries
description: Condition where the carotid arteries share a common starting point

name: complete atrioventricular canal
description: Congenital heart defect with large defect in center of heart

name: complicated atrial shunt
description: Atrial shunt with additional complex features or complications

name: congenital cardiomyopathy
description: A genetic condition causing abnormal heart muscle development.

name: congenital heart disease
description: A range of structural heart defects present from birth.

name: congenital heart disease with anterior right aortic arch
description: Structural heart defect with aorta arching to the right.

name: congenital heart disease with decreased pulmonary vascularity
description: Heart defect associated with reduced blood flow to the lungs.

name: coronary artery abnormality
description: Unusual formation or course of the coronary arteries.

name: coronary artery aneurysm
description: Dilation of a coronary artery segment.

name: cyanotic congenital heart disease with increased pulmonary vascularity
description: Heart defect with excessive lung blood flow causing low oxygen levels.

name: cyanotic congenital heart disease with precapillary hypertension vascularity
description: Heart defect leading to high pressure in lung blood vessels before capillaries.

name: decreased cerebral vascular transit time
description: Reduced time for blood to travel through cerebral circulation.

name: decreased intracranial vessel size
description: Reduction in the diameter of blood vessels within the skull.

name: decreased renal artery diastolic flow
description: Reduced blood flow in the renal artery during heart relaxation phase.

name: dextrocardia
description: Heart located on the right side of the thorax.

name: dilated azygos vein
description: Enlargement of the vein draining the thoracic cavity.

name: dissecting aneurysm of the ascending aorta or arch
description: Tear in the aorta wall in the ascending section or arch.

name: early renal vein opacification
description: Premature filling of the renal veins with contrast.

name: embolus
description: Obstruction of a vessel by a traveling clot or foreign material.

name: enlarged pulmonary veins
description: Dilation of veins returning blood from lungs to heart.

name: eosinophilia
description: Increased eosinophil count, typically found in blood tests.

name: filling defect in right ventricle
description: Area within the right ventricle that does not fill with contrast, indicating potential mass or thrombus.

name: gas embolism
description: Air bubble occluding a blood vessel.

name: gastrointestinal system bleeding
description: Bleeding within the gastrointestinal tract that can be from various sources like the stomach, intestines, or esophagus.

name: generalized pulmonary arterial hypervascularity
description: Increased vascular markings within the lung fields due to increased blood flow through pulmonary arteries.

name: generalized pulmonary arterial hypovascularity
description: Decreased vascular markings within the lung fields indicating decreased blood flow through pulmonary arteries.

name: heart failure in childhood
description: Inability of the heart to pump sufficient blood in children, resulting in various symptoms and signs.

name: heart failure in the first month of life
description: Heart's inability to meet circulatory demands in neonates, manifesting early in life.

name: heart failure in the first week of life
description: Severe form of cardiac insufficiency occurring in the first seven days post-birth.

name: hemangioma
description: A benign tumor consisting of a mass of blood vessels.

name: hepatic vein dilatation
description: Enlargement of the hepatic veins, potentially indicating underlying circulatory issues.

name: high-output heart function
description: Increased cardiac output that exceeds the body's demands, often seen in certain physiological or pathological states.

name: high-resistance internal carotid artery flow
description: Increased resistance in blood flow within the internal carotid artery, indicating possible obstruction or stenosis.

name: hypercalcemia
description: Elevated calcium levels in the blood, often indicated by calcifications in imaging.

name: hyperphosphatasemia
description: Elevated levels of alkaline phosphatase enzyme, often secondary to liver or bone disease.

name: hyperphosphatemia
description: Elevated phosphate levels in the blood, often associated with renal failure or other metabolic disorders.

name: hypertension
description: Persistently high arterial blood pressure, which can lead to various complications detectable on imaging.

name: hypocalcemia
description: Low calcium levels in the blood, often related to parathyroid disorders or renal disease.

name: hypoglycemia
description: Low blood sugar levels, which can lead to neurological deficits if severe.

name: hypokalemia
description: Low potassium levels in the blood, often causing muscle weakness and cardiac arrhythmias.

name: hypophosphatemia
description: Low levels of phosphate in the blood, often associated with vitamin D deficiency or hyperparathyroidism.

name: increased intracranial vessel size
description: Enlargement of cerebral vessels that can indicate vascular disorders such as AVMs or aneurysms.

name: increased portal vein flow
description: Elevated blood flow in the portal vein, often indicating portal hypertension.

name: increased renal artery diastolic flow
description: Increased diastolic flow velocity in the renal artery, indicative of changes in renal blood flow dynamics.

name: increased resistance index of renal transplant
description: Elevation in resistance index, typically indicating potential transplant dysfunction.

name: inferior vena cava obstruction
description: Blockage or narrowing of the inferior vena cava, affecting venous return to the heart.

name: internal jugular vein thrombosis
description: Presence of a thrombus within the internal jugular vein.

name: intestinal lymphangiectasia
description: Dilatation of intestinal lymphatic vessels, leading to protein loss and malabsorption.

name: intracranial arteriovenous shunting
description: Abnormal blood flow between arteries and veins in the brain, bypassing capillaries.

name: intracranial hypervascularity
description: Increased blood vessel density or flow in the brain.

name: ischemia of digits
description: Reduced blood flow to the fingers or toes, causing tissue damage.

name: ischemic heart disease
description: A disorder caused by insufficient blood flow to the heart muscle.

name: lack of filling of intracranial vessels
description: Absence of normal blood flow or opacity in the brain's blood vessels, indicating obstruction or occlusion.

name: large aortic arch
description: An enlarged aortic arch, possibly indicating underlying conditions or variants.

name: large ascending aorta
description: Enlargement of the ascending portion of the aorta, indicating potential aneurysm or hypertension.

name: large main pulmonary artery
description: Dilatation of the main pulmonary artery, possibly suggesting hypertension or congenital causes.

name: late onset of cyanosis in neonatal congenital heart disease
description: Development of cyanosis in a newborn, indicating possible cardiac shunting issues.

name: left atrial enlargement
description: Increase in size of the left atrium, often due to conditions like hypertension or valvular disease.

name: left ventricular enlargement
description: Enlargement of the left ventricle, often due to hypertension or valvular heart disease.

name: left-to-right shunt in congenital heart disease
description: Abnormal blood flow from the left to the right side of the heart, often due to congenital defects.

name: localized pulmonary vessel enlargement
description: Focal dilatation of blood vessels in the lungs, indicating underlying vascular issues.

name: lymphedema
description: Swelling due to lymphatic system obstruction or damage.

name: macular stains
description: Capillary malformations on the skin, usually benign.

name: main pulmonary artery obstruction
description: Blockage in the main artery carrying blood from the heart to the lungs.

name: marked cyanosis in first week of life
description: Severe bluish discoloration in newborns within the first week due to lack of oxygen.

name: mass in inferior vena cava
description: Abnormal growth within the large vein that carries deoxygenated blood from the lower body to the heart.

name: massive cardiomegaly
description: Severe enlargement of the heart.

name: mild or intermittent cyanosis in first week
description: Slight or occasional bluish discoloration in newborns within the first week due to lack of oxygen.

name: mitral insufficiency
description: Backward flow of blood from the left ventricle to the left atrium due to mitral valve dysfunction.

name: pancytopenia
description: Reduction in the number of red and white blood cells, as well as platelets.

name: pericardial calcification
description: Calcium deposits in the pericardium, the sac surrounding the heart.

name: pericardial effusion
description: Accumulation of fluid in the space around the heart.

name: pneumopericardium
description: Presence of air in the pericardial cavity.

name: polycythemia
description: Increased concentration of hemoglobin, often due to increased red blood cell mass.

name: portal hypertension
description: Elevated blood pressure in the portal venous system.

name: portal vein gas
description: Presence of gas within the portal vein.

name: portal vein obstruction
description: Blockage of the vein carrying blood from the intestines to the liver.

name: portal vein thrombosis
description: Clot formation within the portal vein.

name: portal venous hypertension
description: Increased pressure within the portal vein due to blockage or other issues.

name: prolonged cerebral vascular transit time
description: Delayed movement of blood through the brain's vascular system.

name: prosthetic valve regurgitation
description: Leakage of blood through a replaced heart valve.

name: pulmonary arterial hypertension
description: High blood pressure in the arteries of the lungs.

name: pulmonary artery aneurysm
description: Ballooning of the pulmonary artery.

name: pulmonary artery calcification
description: Calcification within the pulmonary artery walls.

name: pulmonary artery catheterization
description: Placement of a catheter in the pulmonary artery for diagnostic or therapeutic purposes.

name: pulmonary artery rupture
description: Rupture of the pulmonary artery often due to trauma or invasive procedures.

name: pulmonary artery stenosis
description: Narrowing of the pulmonary artery.

name: pulmonary embolism
description: Obstruction of the pulmonary artery or its branches by a thrombus.

name: pulmonary hypertension
description: Increased blood pressure in the pulmonary arteries.

name: Raynaud phenomenon
description: A condition causing discoloration of the fingers and toes due to vasospasm.

name: renal artery aneurysm or microaneurysm
description: Abnormal dilatation of the renal artery.

name: renal vein thrombosis
description: Clot formation within the renal vein.

name: right atrial enlargement
description: Increase in size of the right atrium.

name: right ventricular enlargement
description: Increase in size of the right ventricle.

name: right-to-left atrial shunt
description: Blood flow from the right atrium to the left atrium bypassing the lungs.

name: right-to-left shunt at ductus level
description: Abnormal right-to-left flow at the ductus arteriosus.

name: right-to-left shunt or admixture lesion in congenital heart disease
description: Presence of right-to-left blood flow or mixing in congenital heart conditions.

name: right-to-left ventricular shunt
description: Abnormal right-to-left blood flow between ventricles.

name: small aortic arch
description: Aortic arch is smaller than normal size.

name: small ascending aorta
description: Reduced size of the ascending aorta.

name: small heart
description: Heart size smaller than normal.

name: splenic vein obstruction
description: Blockage of the splenic vein.

name: subclavian steal syndrome
description: Reverse blood flow in the vertebral artery due to subclavian artery stenosis.

name: superior mesenteric artery syndrome
description: Compression of the third part of the duodenum by the aorta and the overlying superior mesenteric artery, leading to small bowel obstruction.

name: superior vena cava syndrome
description: Obstruction of blood flow through the superior vena cava, often due to malignant or benign causes.

name: supravalvular aortic stenosis
description: Narrowing of the ascending aorta just above the aortic valve, leading to outflow obstruction.

name: systemic hypertension
description: Elevated blood pressure within the systemic arteries often leading to cardiovascular complications.

name: systemic hypotension
description: Abnormally low blood pressure affecting systemic circulation, potentially leading to inadequate perfusion.

name: systemic-to-pulmonary vascular shunt
description: Abnormal connection allowing blood flow between systemic and pulmonary circulation.

name: telangiectasia
description: Visible small dilated blood vessels near the skin surface or mucous membranes.

name: third mogul sign
description: Radiographic sign indicating enlarged left atrial appendage.

name: thrombocythemia
description: Condition characterized by an elevated platelet count in the blood.

name: tricuspid insufficiency
description: Incompetence of the tricuspid valve leading to regurgitation of blood into the right atrium.

name: unilateral pulmonary arterial hypervascularity
description: Increased blood vessel density in one lung, possibly due to shunt or other vascular anomalies.

name: vascular malformation
description: Abnormal cluster of blood vessels either capillary, venous, arterial, or mixed.

name: vasculopathy
description: Disease of the blood vessels, leading to structural or functional changes.

name: vasomotor symptoms
description: Symptoms due to changes in blood vessel diameter, often experienced as hot flashes or flushing.

name: venous anomaly
description: Abnormal configuration or presence of veins.

name: venous dilatation
description: Enlargement of veins due to increased blood volume or pressures within.

name: venous occlusion
description: Obstruction of a venous vessel leading to impaired blood flow.

name: venous thrombosis
description: Formation of a blood clot within a vein causing obstruction of blood flow.

name: ventricular septal defect
description: Congenital defect characterized by an opening in the ventricular septum, allowing blood to flow between the right and left ventricles.
